MAST.parsers.recipetemplateparser module¶

class MAST.parsers.recipetemplateparser.RecipeTemplateParser(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: MAST.utility.mastobj.MASTObj

Class for parsing the template recipe file in the input file and creating a “personalized” recipe file where any <sys> and <N> from the recipe template have been filled in according to information from the input file. Attributes:

self.input_options <InputOptions>: Input options from input file. self.template_file <str>: Path to the recipe template file self.personal_recipe <str>: Path to the personalized recipe. self.ingredient_list <list of str>: List of ingredients mentioned

in the recipe template file.

self.chunks <list of list>: List of chunks

get_unique_ingredients()[source]¶

fetches the ingredients names

make_metadata_entries(processing_lines)[source]¶

Add metadata entry for all ingredients. Does not change line information.

old_parsing()[source]¶
parse()[source]¶

Parses the template recipe file and creates the personalized recipe file

parse_chunk(chunk)[source]¶

Parse a chunk of lines. Args:

chunk <list>: List of lines
Returns:
expandedchunk <list>: List of lines
process_defects(processing_lines, n_defects, d_defects)[source]¶

replace <N> with the equivalent number of lines based on the number of defects given in the input options

Args:

processing_lines <list of str>: recipe lines to proceess n_defects <int>: number of defected systems d_defects <dict>: dictionary of defects, including labels and

positions.
process_hop_combinations(processing_lines, d_neblines)[source]¶

replace <n-n> with neb labels which are keys of the neblines dict of the input options.

Args:
processing_lines <list of str>: recipe lines to process. d_neblines <dict of str>: dictionary of NEB lines.
process_images(processing_lines, n_images)[source]¶

replace <img-n> with the equivalent number of lines based on the number of images found in the input_options

process_phononlines(processing_lines)[source]¶

add phonon information to the metadata. Does not change line info.

process_system_name(processing_lines, system_name)[source]¶

replace <sys> with the system name from the input options
